abstract: The $7.9 billion takeover of the Australian Securities Exchange by the Singapore Exchange teetered on the verge of collapse on Tuesday after Australia said it would probably block the deal.
snippet: The $7.9 billion takeover of the Australian Securities Exchange by the Singapore Exchange teetered on the verge of collapse on Tuesday after Australia said it would probably block the deal.
lead_paragraph: The $7.9 billion takeover of the Australian stock exchange by the Singapore Exchange teetered on the verge of collapse on Tuesday after Australia said it planned to block the deal, setting an ominous example for the big mergers currently under review in Europe and North America.

headline.main: Regulators Set to Reject Merger of Singapore and Australia Exchanges
